rdfs:label: Portfolio, Program & Project Management Module - OAA v5.0.0
rdfs:comment: Core PPM module for managing portfolios, programs, and projects with Product Breakdown Structure (PBS) and Work Breakdown Structure (WBS). Localization handled via bridge relationships to Localization Module.

entities.rdfs:label: Organisation
entities.rdfs:comment: A legal entity or business unit that participates in the platform ecosystem.
entities.oaa:description: The root entity representing a legal entity or business unit that participates in the platform ecosystem. Supports four organization types: platform_owner, client, agency, affiliate. Every PPM entity must belong to an organisation. Localization settings applied via ppm_localization_bridge (not embedded). Organizations establish strategic objectives and allocate resources across their portfolio of investments.

entities.rdfs:label: Portfolio
entities.rdfs:comment: A collection of programmes, projects, and operational activities grouped together to facilitate effective management.
entities.oaa:description: A collection of programmes, projects, and operational activities grouped together to facilitate effective management and achieve strategic business objectives. Portfolios align organizational strategy with execution and optimize resource allocation across initiatives. Portfolios inherit localization from parent organisation unless explicitly overridden via bridge relationship.

entities.rdfs:label: Programme
entities.rdfs:comment: A group of related projects managed in a coordinated manner to obtain benefits.
entities.oaa:description: A group of related projects, subsidiary programmes, and programme activities managed in a coordinated manner to obtain benefits not available from managing them individually. Programmes deliver transformational change and realize strategic benefits through coordinated project delivery. Programmes bridge strategic intent (portfolio) with tactical execution (projects). Localization cascades from portfolio unless overridden.

entities.rdfs:label: Project
entities.rdfs:comment: A temporary endeavour undertaken to create a unique product, service, or result.
entities.oaa:description: A temporary endeavour undertaken to create a unique product, service, or result with defined beginning and end dates, specific objectives, and constrained resources. Projects are the primary execution vehicle for delivering specific outputs within time, cost, and quality constraints. Projects are the lowest level in the PPM hierarchy where actual work is performed. Can have independent PBS and WBS. Localization can be overridden at project level for multi-regional delivery.

entities.rdfs:label: Product Breakdown Structure
entities.rdfs:comment: A hierarchical decomposition defining WHAT will be delivered.
entities.oaa:description: Product Breakdown Structure - A hierarchical decomposition defining WHAT will be delivered. Can represent: (1) Products marketed by Platform Owner, (2) Products/services marketed by Client organization, OR (3) Deliverables from PPM projects. Independent of HOW work is organized (see WBS). PBS defines product structure, deliverables hierarchy, and output organization. Supports product discovery, marketing, and project deliverable definition across platform owner and client contexts.

entities.rdfs:label: Work Breakdown Structure
entities.rdfs:comment: A hierarchical decomposition defining HOW work will be organized and executed.
entities.oaa:description: Work Breakdown Structure - A hierarchical decomposition defining HOW work will be organized and executed by the organization. Specific to the organization performing the work (platform_owner, client, agency, or affiliate). Defines work organization, not deliverables (see PBS for deliverables). WBS enables effort estimation, supports scheduling and resource allocation. Each organization maintains their own WBS for work they perform. Supports distributed and multi-organizational project delivery.

entities.rdfs:label: Stakeholder
entities.rdfs:comment: An individual, group, or organisation that may affect or be affected by PPM activities.
entities.oaa:description: An individual, group, or organisation that may affect, be affected by, or perceive itself to be affected by a decision, activity, or outcome of a portfolio, programme, or project. Stakeholders have varying levels of authority, interest, and influence in PPM activities and outcomes. Stakeholders are linked to PPM entities through roles and RACI assignments. Can have personal localization preferences that override organizational defaults.

businessRules.name: Organisation Required for All Entities
businessRules.condition: IF Entity is Portfolio, Programme, Project, PBS, WBS, or Stakeholder
businessRules.action: THEN Entity.org_id MUST reference a valid Organisation
businessRules.message: Every PPM entity must belong to an organisation

businessRules.name: Valid Org Type
businessRules.action: THEN Organisation.org_type MUST be one of: platform_owner, client, agency, affiliate
businessRules.message: Organisation type must be a valid enum value

businessRules.name: Programme Requires Portfolio
businessRules.action: THEN Programme.portfolio_id MUST reference a valid Portfolio
businessRules.message: Every programme must belong to a portfolio

businessRules.name: PBS Type Consistency
businessRules.message: Platform product PBS should link to platform product catalog

businessRules.name: WBS Effort Estimate Range
businessRules.action: THEN WBS.estimated_effort_hours SHOULD be between 8 and 80
businessRules.message: Work packages should be decomposed to 8-80 hour range for effective management

businessRules.name: Financial Values in USD
businessRules.condition: IF financial field (budget, cost, revenue) is set
businessRules.action: THEN field name MUST end with _usd suffix and value MUST be in USD base currency
businessRules.message: All financial values must be stored in USD base currency

businessRules.name: Dates in ISO 8601
businessRules.action: THEN value MUST be in ISO 8601 format with timezone
businessRules.message: All dates must be stored in ISO 8601 format

businessRules.name: No Circular PBS Hierarchy
businessRules.action: THEN PBS hierarchy MUST NOT contain circular references
businessRules.message: PBS hierarchy cannot have circular dependencies

businessRules.name: No Circular WBS Hierarchy
businessRules.action: THEN WBS hierarchy MUST NOT contain circular references
businessRules.message: WBS hierarchy cannot have circular dependencies

businessRules.name: Localization Via Bridge
businessRules.action: THEN localization MUST be applied via localization_bridge_refs, NOT embedded fields
businessRules.message: Localization must be handled via bridge relationships to Localization Module
